content: pin-striped fingerless mitts by jenjoyce design about a colorful & easy pair of striped fingerless mitts to knit without having to cut yarn from beginning to end pattern is for one-size in dk weight with suggestions of how to make bigger or smaller excellent beginner level knitting project in stockinette stitch using two colors single rib and simple increases combine different colors use variegated yarns two-tones of one color or mix up different yarn textures to make attractive & super fun yarn shown in knit picks swish dk you will need 2 balls of yarn in dk weight one each of two colors a main color mc and a contrast color cc total yardage used approx 50 grams gauge 6 stitch = 1 inch needles us 4 3 5 mm or size to get gauge one or two sizes smaller than size to get gauge for ribbing measures approx 7 18cm circumference at palm and 7 - 9 18-23cm length size one size to fit womens med-mens small for smaller mitts use finer yarn and/or needles to get 6 5-7 sts = 1 to fit xsm women or child for larger use thicker yarn and/or larger needles to get 5 -5 5 sts = 1 to fit xlg women or mens other materials tapestry needle markers begin  you will not cut either color yarn while knitting from beginning to end but to take up the previous color and switch out each round 1 with smaller needles loosely cast on 44 stitches place marker and join together to work in-the-round in mc work rib in a *knit 1- purl 1* or *knit2-purl 2* pattern for 9 rounds or until desired width of rib 2 switch to larger needles and cc knit 1 round in mc work 1 round page 1 pin-striped fingerless mitts  jenjoyce design continue alternating each color for 37 rounds ending having knit a cc round note mitts are approx 9 in length from top to bottom if you d like them shorter simply begin the next step after fewer rounds 3 on mc round place markers for the thumb gusset as follows knit 21 stitches place marker knit 2 stitches place marker knit 21 stitches to end thumb gussets  4 in cc work increase round as follows knit up to first marker slip marker m1r knit up to second marker m1l see below for m1r & m1l 2 stitches increased m1r lift the stitch beneath the next stitch it will be in cc on to the needle knit into it creating a right-leaning increase then knit the next stitch m1l lift the stitch beneath the last stitch you just knit it will be in cc on to the needle knit into it creating a left-leaning increase then knit the next stitch continue to increase every-other- round inside of gusset markers on the cc round until you have 16 gusset stitches inside of the two gusset markers continue with no increases inside of the gusset markers
